title.narrative: Freedom of expression, Council of Europe
Freedom of expression, Council of Europe

description.narrative: Det föreslagna projektets övergripande mål är att: Säkerställa att rätten till yttrandefrihet och rätten till informationsfrihet respekteras, skyddas och uppfylls, utan diskriminering, i Bosnien och Hercegovina. Del 1 kommer att behandla temat yttrandefrihet/mediefrihet med särskilt fokus på hatpropaganda. Komponentens fokus ligger på att förbättra effekten av MHRR. Del 2 kommer att behandla temat informationsfrihet/tillgång till information. Del 3 kommer att behandla samordningen av MHRR i allmänhet med tanke på mandatet för mänskliga rättigheter.

The overall objective of the proposed project is to: Ensure that the right to freedom of expression and the right to freedom of information are respected, protected and fulfilled, without discrimination, in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Component 1 will deal with the theme of freedom of expression / freedom of the media with a special focus on hate propaganda. The component's focus is on improving the effect of MHRR. Component 2 will deal with the theme of freedom of information / access to information. Component 3 will address the coordination of the MHRR in general with a view to the mandate for human rights.

The proposed action builds on past and current CoE activities in the area of Freedom of Access to Information/Media and Freedom of Expression in BiH, including a Sida-funded pilot project implemented in 2019/2020 (extended due to COVID-19). The proposed project has three inter-connected components: 1) Freedom of Expression (with a specific focus on Hate Speech); 2) Freedom of Access to Information; and 3) Capacity-building of the MHRR to enhance its mandate . The objectives of the projects are to contribute to ensuring a human rights-based legal framework and practice, by enhancing the capacity of key duty-bearers (principally the MHRR) and rights-holder representatives (including media actors and CSOs) to integrate a human rights-based approach in their work (including awareness-raising; legislative analysis; capacity-building; monitoring, advocacy and reporting). The Theory of Change of the project is that effective implementation of a human rights-based legislative framework on Freedom of Expression and Freedom of Information is critical for BiHs progress as a Rule of Law state. Reflecting the interdependence of human rights, vindicating the rights to FoE/FoI is dependent on respect for a range of other human rights, including participation, assembly, education, etc. In turn, the human rights to FoE/FoI are critical for other rights to be guaranteed, including participation in public life; free and fair elections; conscience/religion; privacy; access to justice etc. The right to equality and non-discrimination is a cross-cutting legal entitlement. A central premise of the project is that enhanced capacity/systems for full-cycle (see below) FoE/FoI monitoring will provide a foundation for enhanced MHRR delivery of its mandate with regard to the full spectrum of human rights. The proposed projects overall objective (impact) is to: Ensure that the right to freedom of expression and the right to freedom of information is respected, protected and fulfilled, without discrimination, in BiH.
Specific objectives (intermediate outcomes) are: i) Enhanced effectiveness of the MHRR and other key actors in BiH to address freedom of expression/media (in particular hate speech). Aiming at enhancing substantive awareness/knowledge and methodological skills/capacity to implement the full cycle of human rights monitoring - from information gathering, human rights gap analysis/needs assessment, through to design/delivery of action for change (legislative drafting, awareness-raising/training, development of guidelines/tools, domestic/international reporting, advocacy, etc).
ii) Enhanced effectiveness of the MHRR and other key actors in BiH to address freedom of information, Aiming at enhancing substantive awareness/knowledge and methodological skills/capacity to implement the full cycle of human rights monitoring - from information gathering, human rights gap analysis/needs assessment, through to design/delivery of action for change (legislative drafting, awareness-raising/advocacy, domestic/international reporting, etc).
iii) Enhanced organisational management capacity of the MHRR as a key duty-bearer institution to apply a human rights-based approach in the execution of its mandate (aiming at project management, coordination of FoE/FoI monitoring and information sharing/liaison with relevant domestic and international actors).

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: From the Completion memo of previous 2019-2020 project with CoE: The Council of Europe has developed a comprehensive set of standards guaranteeing freedom of expression, which as stated by Article 10 of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) encompasses the right to receive and impart information. Due to its international authority, know-how and extensive network of experts and partners, the Council of Europe is uniquely placed to provide assistance to member and nonmember States to ensure respect for freedom of expression. The comparative advantage of the Council of Europe in relation to other International Organisations active in the field of freedom of expression in Bosnia and Herzegovina (mainly the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe) lies in its key standard setting role in the field, as well as its established long-term successful partnerships with the main stakeholders of the project.In addition, the long-standing co-operation between the institutions in Bosnia and Herzegovina and the Council of Europe has enabled them to treat the Council as a reliable partner in the promotion and implementation of freedom of expression standards through capacity development initiatives, providing international expertise and other activities. The main achievements of the project are: A thorough analysis of seven legal acts relevant for freedom of expression undertaken by international experts and reviewed by local expert; A set of clear recommendations on what parts of the analysed legal acts should be amended to come in line with European standards that were presented to the relevant stakeholders; A discussion on what other laws are needed to promote a favourable environment for freedom of expression is on-going among relevant stakeholder groups who are currently considering draft laws on media pluralism and transparency of media ownership and advertising; The Study-Compilation of the Practice on Reporting on Marginalised Groups in Bosnia and Herzegovinas Media that was promoted among the relevant stakeholders including different level of governments representatives or ombudspersons. This project aimed to review the legal framework on media freedom in Bosnia and Herzegovina and develop recommendations for journalists, spokespersons and Public Relations staff of public institutions to be mindful about reporting and communicating in a human rights sensitive fashion. The project concluded that media reporting and communication in Bosnia and Herzegovina disfavour marginalised groups.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
